function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Studies under the functionalist school focused on rational efforts of managers to maximize efficiency through the coordination and control of work activities.","Impact":"Inadequate coordination and control of work activities could lead to inefficiencies and potential contagion of diseases in the workplace.","Mitigation":"Implementing better coordination and control measures, such as robust health and safety protocols and clear communication channels.","Technologies":"Health monitoring systems and workplace automation technologies.","People":"Employees and workers in the organization.","Owner":"Organizational management and leadership."},{"Description":"Shift toward studying contingency variables such as environmental uncertainty, and determining their effect on structure.","Impact":"Uncertainty about environmental factors could impact the ability to plan and implement effective disease mitigation measures in the workplace.","Mitigation":"Conducting thorough environmental risk assessments and developing flexible disease mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems and predictive modeling tools.","People":"Risk management and health and safety teams within the organization.","Owner":"Organizational leadership and risk management teams."},{"Description":"Bounded rationality studies suggesting that managers are boundedly rational, and decision making entails a satisficing rather than an optimizing approach.","Impact":"Suboptimal decision-making in disease mitigation strategies due to bounded rationality and satisficing approaches.","Mitigation":"Providing decision-support tools and training to help managers make more informed and rational decisions in disease mitigation.","Technologies":"Decision-support software and data analysis tools.","People":"Managers and decision-makers within the organization.","Owner":"Organizational leadership and human resources departments."},{"Description":"Power dependence theory and institutional theory providing a supplemental and different viewpoint for conceptualizing organizations.","Impact":"Influence of power dynamics and institutional pressures may impact the prioritization and implementation of disease mitigation measures within the organization.","Mitigation":"Creating transparent decision-making processes and accountability structures to mitigate the influence of power dynamics and institutional pressures on disease mitigation efforts.","Technologies":"Blockchain-based transparency solutions and governance software.","People":"Organizational leadership, governance bodies, and regulatory stakeholders.","Owner":"Top-level management and governance bodies within the organization."}]}
